Name: Fragment of a robed statue
Description: Upper part of a robed statue preserved between the waist and the shoulders. Only traces remain of the right arm, originally attached to the body with a peg. The hand of the covered left arm lies on the right breast. The smooth garment was draped over the left shoulder, pulled diagonally by the seam across the left wrist, passed under the right armpit and then folded over the left part of the robe, whereby the seam forms a slight curve. Near the right shoulderblade, another part of the crooked upper part of the robe can be seen.
